It has been constructed using found and redundant materials, balancing functionality and subversion.

events.name: Drop in: Kollektiv Collective
events.notes: Our in house gallery Generation & Display host Kollektiv Collective

events.name: Drop in: Timing Is Divine
events.notes:
Vida Vojić performs her solo alchemical drum work 'Timing Is Divine'
London premier.
No booking but no entry mid performance

events.name: Drawing Performance Project: Lucy Algar
events.notes: Playful Interrogation of the Body Through Drawing

events.name: Aventures in Psychophysicality w/ Sarah Walton
events.notes: Sarah Walton, ex Royal Ballet soloist, expands intuitive connection, to each other and the world around us. No experience necessary

factsheet.heading: Background
paragraphs: Housed in an industrial 50s warehouse formerly occupied by Rolls Royce and acquired in a semi-derelict state, its transformation was approached by the artist Henry Krokatsis as a large evolving sculptural work. It has been constructed using found and redundant materials, balancing functionality and subversion. The 12,000 sq ft space currently houses a not-for-profit project space and a 1000 sq ft roof terrace and event space. There are 22 purpose-built artists’ studios across 2 floors. This unfolding social sculpture aims to act as a source of inspiration, enquiry, and experimentation.

factsheet.heading: What's Happening over the Weekend..
paragraphs: Many of our artists will open their studios to the public.  Staff Canteen, our rooftop bar and restaurant will be open.

Our inhouse gallery Generation&Display, hosts work by Kollektiv Collective.
On Saturday we have 2  workshops. 
Former Royal Ballet soloist Sarah Walton on movement
and Lucy Algar's Drawing Performance Project
On Sunday we're delighted to host a performance by Swedish Alchemical drummer Vida Vojić

name: Queensrollahouse
